website_summaries.verdict: The 3 key functions of this versatile blower are a powerful impeller-powered blower, leaf vacuum, and mulcher.
pros: Metal impeller creates a great blower force, and aids in mulching leaves
Includes vacuum tube, bottom-zip bag, power insert, concentrator nozzle, and cord storage hook
Variable speed control lets you choose the horse power produced by unit
cons: The vacuum has issues: Slips off after being clicked into place, dust blows out of the bag, it fell apart after a few uses in some cases

website_summaries.verdict: The metal impeller on this electric blower gives extra strength to blowing and mulching.
pros: 3 functions include blower, leaf vacuum and mulcher
Leaves mulch as they get vacuumed into the bag for better compacting
Metal impeller improves power and mulching
Blower includes vacuum tube, bottom-zip bag, power insert, concentrator nozzle, and cord-storage hook
Variable speed for different blowing settings
cons: Vacuum bag does not hold up
Bag slips off when in use

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum bag is junk
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this product 5 stars, if the bag hadn't fallen apart after using it a few times. It is great having the zipper on the bottom of the bag but that's where the pressure of the leaves goes and the zipper is not strong enough to hold. The machine vacuums up leaves perfectly. Everyone should have one, I even have had friends order the same product....but now a replacement bag costs half as much as the $60 I paid for the whole thing. I am disappointed that the replacement bag cost is so unreasonable, when it only lasts for s few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Called Toro's service center and they were useless. I cant be the first one with this ...
customer_reviews.text: Strangest thing. Opened the box, put it together went out to blow leaves for the first time and it stopped working within 30 seconds. Tried multiple cords but nothing. Strange because I got this to replace my other Toro blower which had the same issue, but that one had been used for a season so I thought it just broke. Called Toro's service center and they were useless. I cant be the first one with this issue?
customer_reviews.author: PAK

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the zipper on the leaf bag!
customer_reviews.text: The zipper on the Toro leaf bag pull away from the bag after only four uses of the Leaf Vacuum! Leaf fragments started blowing out around the ruined zipper. Then I could not unzip the rest of the bag to get the leaves out. When I went to order the replacement bag it turned out to $30+ dollars for a leaf vacuum that was $46 in total.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Very poor bag zipper quality
customer_reviews.text: It's a great blower. The engine works beautifully. However the zipper of the bag failed after 5 uses or so. It tears off easily. I'm not sure whether this is under warrantee. If you want to use the unit for mulching the leaves, you need the bag.
customer_reviews.author: D. Le

customer_reviews.title: Sucks
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be more powerful that "one model down". This one is a disaster. Feels like the air "leaks" out of the intake, so the "blowing" power seems greatly reduced. Total piece of crap - I would never buy it again. I did see other reviews which said this wasn't a great one, but not many. Turns out, they were very accurate. If I could give it zero stars, I would.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 30 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working while sucking up leaves, 30 minutes after unpacking it. The motor stopped and wouldn't start again. Toro used to be a superior product . . .
customer_reviews.author: Sam Thayer

customer_reviews.title: Weak shoulder strap attachment to bag
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 51619 Ultra Blower/Vac, item arrived quickly and in good shape. I bought it primarily for leaf vac function. First use today-- Pro: Power unit excellent, metallic blades works MUCH better than plastic impellers of older generation. Con: Bag strap... In particular, attachment point between shoulder strap and bag. The stitching appears to be too wide and not enough of the strap was stitched. (see pic) At this rate, one more use and the strap will be detached. Toro, I hope you are seeing this review, please address this defect. I do not recommend this product as a leaf vac until this is addressed.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Love the adjustable air flow feature.
customer_reviews.text: I like this blower. I love the ability to change the speed of the air flow. I haven't used the mulch feature yet. The "leaves and such" gets sucked into the motor/ blade part. The instructions warn if a rock gets into the motor, it could break or damage the main blade. Then it is game over for both uses of this blower. I love the blower. Not worth breaking the blade for the mulch feature. We have lots of little rocks around here. We also have a macadamia tree, which the nut shells are as hard as rock.
customer_reviews.author: R.P.

customer_reviews.title: Product doesn't last and warranty will cost you shipping
customer_reviews.text: Owned for approximately 6 months and has a grinding bearing sound and yesterday smelled like an electrical fire was starting. Called Toro and I have to pay for the return shipping for a replacement. It will cost $42 for shipping to include a box for shipping, weight and distance traveled. They said a new replacement but I figure it will be a remanufactured unit. Original cost was $57 spend $42 more to get a reworked unit. Shame on you Toro, I'll Never buy one again.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 4-years! Now I need a new electric leaf blower.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this electric blower on December 15, 2015. It's November 9, 2019, and the motor started to make a grinding noise and I can smell a bit of smoke. Guess that means it's due for replacement. It lasted nearly 4 years, so given the price, it has served me well. I wouldn't bother with a 2-3 year warranty, given it wears out at the near 4-year mark. I'll purchase another model/brand (Cordless Leaf Blower – 20V 4.0 AH Lithium Battery Powered) for the cordless feature and comparable speed at 200 mph. However, given a 4-year life expectancy and the power for the price isn't too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Jana

customer_reviews.title: Speed/power  switch failed in a week
customer_reviews.text: I was super impressed when I first used it. It had a very low speed great for small area and less dust. Also very powerful high speed My last Toro lasted 20 years of use and abuse so I though this one would last my lifetime. BUT.. A WEEK LATER, THE POWER SWITCH FAILED. I COULD NOT TURN IT OFF!! Had to unplug. The variable switch does not work. Only works on high and won’t turn off. Returning
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wimpy for its bulk and weight
customer_reviews.text: I have another corded leaf blower, a Weedeater brand that I loaned to a friend. I purchased this one as a replacement, and based my choice on the power rating of this machine. I'm rather disappointed. My Weedeater cost less and is much stronger. This Toro struggles to blow even when the hose is directly adjacent to the leaves. For its wimpy blowing capacity, it's also rather heavy and bulky. If it had cost more and wasn't such a hassle, I'd return it and get something else. As it is, it's marginally adequate. I would not buy it again, and I would not recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Sunhotmoon

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this last September (2018) and have literally used it 2 times. We pulled it out this week to use it again for a large amount of leaves, and it won't even turn on. I realize this isn't the highest quality, or the most expensive product for leave and yard maintenance but I would expect it to last longer than 2 uses! I just hope the 2 year warranty it says it has actually does something to fix it/replace it. This is not good product quality for Toro.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis R.

customer_reviews.title: Blow back in face
customer_reviews.text: We had the previous iteration of this product. It was excellent quality and last almost 20 years. This arrived and we had high hopes for it, given that that blades were now metal rather than plastic. We were concerned about the bag issues other buyers have noted, but did not have the opportunity to see if it was an issue. We used it once and returned it. When using it as a leaf vacuum, the dirt and debris blows directly into the face. Even with a mask and goggles, it was unbearable. It is a terrible design flaw. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Macky

customer_reviews.title: Hazard!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this blower in Jan '16. It has a very short cord with a grounded plug. Unfortunately, it has proven to be a fire and shock hazard. After several minutes of use (more than five, less than ten), the plug becomes very hot, and begins to smoke, melting and destroying the extension cord, and presenting a fire and shock hazard. It was used properly, with a 3-prong, grounded extension cord. Two different ones, in fact. I'm actually quite surprised, as previous Toro products I've purchased have been fantastic ( I have a 27 year old 2-cycle engine mower that still works great).
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Can't mulch leaves with sticks, cones, nuts etc
customer_reviews.text: I discovered upon receipt that it can't vacuum and mulch anything with sticks, pine cones, nuts, pebbles in it, making the extra weight of it, over non-mulcher, worthless for me, but maybe not for others. Also after first use, sermed like it had less power than my old one. Finally, the ridges in handle plus weight were uncomfortable in my small hands. I decided to stick with my old mulchless Toro for now. First one I had lasted over 20 years, til kid broke it; second one is over 10 yrs, still works fine, much lighter(, but sustained some slight outside damage when dropped from roof. ) Or maybe I'll get a slightly more powerful non-mulcher.
customer_reviews.author: Crtclthinkr

customer_reviews.title: Blasts air into face.
customer_reviews.text: So far with my first season, it works. As in it functions as its supposed to. Mulches leaves in a hurry. However, when using this as a vacuum it leaves (rimshot) a great deal to be desired. It's awkward to hold and maneuver and gets heavy real quick. And my biggest gripe is the awesome blast of air and debris that shoots right up into my face from the point where the bag attaches to the unit. This occurs when there's just a tiny bit of weight in the bag and pressures the clip downward allowing air to escape directly into my eyes if held the way it's directed to be held. Not a big fan.
customer_reviews.author: J. L.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy—blower is heavy and zippered bag is defective
customer_reviews.text: Huge disappointment with bag durability! We have owned this Toro blower for 5 weeks and have used it for light leaf removal 3 times. Today, the zipper binding pulled away from the metal zipper as I tried to pull the zipper tab. The bag was not full and there was no strain on the zipper—simply incredibly poor quality. The shredded zipper makes the bag useless. What a waste of money; return window expired 10 days ago.
customer_reviews.author: High Expectations

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a older Toro which grenaded the unit when the fan let go. This is heavy, but heavy duty I don't pick up leaves but blow the drive and walkways. Have gutter cleaning attachment from previous unit but this might require a back pack to carry around. Don't like the rheostat type on/off, like volume button. I like on/off I guess if you were blowing leaves from a mulched area that would help. Hopes this last longer the cheaper black one.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Good leaf blower, but leaf catcher is clunky
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blower to deal with my leaf problem. The blower is strong, but the catcher/bagger is a pain. It was easy to setup and only takes a minute to switch from blowing to bagging. The hard part is trying to use the bagger attachment and the bag -- it's clunky, the bag keeps slipping off my shoulder, and the extension cord keeps unplugging (even though there are clips on the back). It does a good job, but is a slow process to pick up all of the leaves. I found it quicker to do it the old way -- blow all of the leaves in a pile and pick them up myself.
customer_reviews.author: Helps2Review

customer_reviews.title: Partner really likes it!
customer_reviews.text: We got this to help make yard work easier and it definitely has. It cuts down work time almost in half because it picks up and mulches the leaves into the bag and it can one easily emptied into a bag or garbage can. However, he did say that it begins to get pretty heavy which affects how easily maneuverable it is. We have tried to avoid sucking up any sticks, twigs, pinecones, or larger debris, but it has sucked up a few acorns and things and it did not affect the vacuum. The dial to turn it off, up, or down is within finger reach and it easy to change. Great product that has helped his quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: Great for leaves, ok for pine needles.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping it would blast all the pine needles out of my hedges and also because I need a mulcher to help make compost. It doesn't work too well for blowing pine needles out of tough spots, I suppose due to their shape. But it is a good mulcher, it even breaks up small twigs, pine needles and fresh leaves. To suck up the pine needles I only use half of the vacuum attachment. I find that if I use both pieces I don't get as good suction. But for dried leaves it's great. For extension cords, the manual (which is available on the Toro website) says 14 gauge for 100 feet and 12 gauge for 150 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much heavier that i expected
customer_reviews.text: Product is pretty heavy. I used the shoulder strap and after a short period, I still experienced the weight of the machine. I used it to vacuum leaves from my gravel. It worked excellent on a low vacuum setting. However, when you move to the other areas of the yard you get pretty covered in dust, in which I kind of expected. I inspected to bag before starting and found a small hole in the seem which was not sewed right (Which i had to repair). In the blowing position you have lots of power to move piles of leaves. Now realizing how heavy it is. I might not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Ditto

customer_reviews.title: Bag zipper failed after using 4 times
customer_reviews.text: Bag zipper unravelled at both ends after using the vac 4 times. Very poor quality. The connection point of the plastic zipper to the zipper ribbon came apart. No way to fix without replacing the entire zipper.
customer_reviews.author: JPhill

customer_reviews.title: Not your Daddys TORO.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this October 18th of 2019. I went to use it last week on October 20th and it just does not work. There is no switches or anything else it could be. Just F%@# !! I want to throw this off a bridge with all the other crappy products I have received on Amazon. This is not your Fathers Toro!. It worked fine when it worked. I have been buying items from reputable manufactures where I can track warranties and get service. To hell with free shipping. It AINT FREE !!
customer_reviews.author: MondoMaryland

customer_reviews.title: Sorry but too bulky for me.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product but unfortunately I am not impressed. The design of the product is bulky. While the blower is good it takes 2 hands to hold it comfortably. The mulch feature is extremely cumbersome. The tube is way too long and makes sucking up debris very time consuming. I can't imagine using this product often around the house. I will probably use the blower and then rake up debris up rather than fight the hard (Too long) tube every time. I definitely would not purchase this model again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fine for just blowing loose laying around patios
customer_reviews.text: Is high powered, light weight confirming my research handier than gas and more powerful than cordless. Packed gutters were 70% doable Still some areas needed digging out first with a tool pointy hefty stick. Fine for just blowing loose laying around patios, walks but for this lightweight a cordless would be more convenient. Do need to be careful swinging draggin cord over a roof top occasionally snagging shingles Still liking the lightweight compared to gas and more power than cordless. Used for clearing pine needles from roof and gutter. Need a sticking for poking loose more stubborns, but quick work. Next time I'm getting the extension kit and save having to go up on the roof!
customer_reviews.author: R. Joe

customer_reviews.title: Weak....Don't be fooled by MPH
customer_reviews.text: Very sad... I purchased this to replace my 23+ year old Toro blower. Only reason?... the switch is almost done and I could not find a replacement part (even Toro). Toro has redesigned their blower exhausts to an oval shape... Bad idea. This limits the volume of airflow. DO NOT be fooled by MPH ratings on any blower! What moves debris is VOLUME! Two stars for the accessories, extended features and quality build, but I wanted a blower. This is weak. Used it twice and knew right away I couldn't keep it. Disappointed because my last Toro was stellar and I didn't think twice before buying another one. Now I have thought twice and had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: BobHarley291

customer_reviews.title: Caught on fire.
customer_reviews.text: Had for a month and a half, used it twice and it caught on fire. I think that's all I need to say.
customer_reviews.author: A. McBride

customer_reviews.title: Similar to earlier models
customer_reviews.text: Similar to earlier models (e.g, 51609) that this model replaces. I confirm that the bag and plastic parts from the earlier model fit this model. Subtract one star because Toro does not seem to offer spare parts for the rheostat (variable power electric switch) that went bad on the earlier model...or any of the other electrical parts of this unit. The blower is effective and powerful. The vac function works best with dry leaves that are free of sticks. Any wetness or sticks causes clogs and makes the process ineffective.
customer_reviews.author: John from Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job on dry leaves
customer_reviews.text: I have birch trees with lot of small leaves. Need to take you time at an angle and it picks them up well. Once they got wet, I had to make sure I didn't over load it. If you do it packs in around the blade area. However, you can drop the pick up tube and use a stick or screw driver and clear it quickly. The problem is more the small leaves than the unit itself. Larger leaves still pick up wet. I find using the ground up leaves work great as a mulch around weed prone areas, as well as mixing them into garden soil.
customer_reviews.author: Harris Statema

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe this thing. It's POWERFUL !!!!!. I put the medium size reducer and it's so strong it mover 2 inch size stones that fall from my stone walkway onto the driveway. It actually blew the small amount of ice that formed on the bottom of my gutters when I was cleaning the leaves out. I had a 6 hp push blower on wheels and this works almost as well. I was able to clean areas of my yard I haven't been able to in years. It's GREAT !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve T

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought the gutter cleaning kit with this unit which comes with several extension tubes to reach up to the roof. This is just what I need to clean the spinner seeds out of the gutters in the Spring and the leaves in the Fall. No more climbing up on the roof with the leaf blower to clear out the gutters. I'm getting too old to be risking a fall by going up on the roof. The blower has several speeds which is helpful sometimes when you don't want to use a single high speed that most other units come with.
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: Powerful enough for wet leaves.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I used it on wet oakleaves to clean out my driveway and gutters. Turned a wet rotting mess into great mulch for my garden. I’m 130lb woman and i found it pretty easy to handle. The wet leaves made the bag pretty heavy, but i just emptied it frequently. Also, really easy to put together, only took 5 minutes to unbox and start yard work. Wish i had bought this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley B.

customer_reviews.title: A Real Porker
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and this leaf blower seemed like a good thing. My 15 year old Toro blower was shot. I find this new one to be awkward and super heavy - perhaps this is due to the metal impeller but it will make you make you work hard to get the job done. Switching from blowing to vacuuming is also more cumbersome than on the old one (many pieces have to snap together and they don't fit well). They (0pd and new)seem to have the same amount of power to blow or vacuum. If you are a small or older person with limited upper body strength this may not be a good choice for you.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond M Jr..

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on a quality product
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this Toro model for years and have been really pleased, but this one out-does it. My older model has a plastic impeller which did get chipped up when vacuuming stuff in the yard and catching an occasional rock. This has a metal impeller which is a fantastic idea and should be much more durable that the plastic one. Plus this has a extra 50 mph of blow power. Too bad I gave it to my son as a Christmas gift. I'm jealous. :)
customer_reviews.author: SAB

customer_reviews.title: Pure frustration.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t get this for the blower, just the leaf vacuum / mulcher. And for that purpose, it’s terrible. If you have a few medium sized leaves, this might be for you. But for large leaves, a lot of leaves, leaves with small twigs, and other imperfections - it’s nothing but frustration. The tube clogs, either right at the opening or where it narrows. If you have a pile of leaves, you pretty much need to pick each leaf one by one off the pile. You spend more time pushing the leaves into the chute than vacuuming. It does produce a finer mulch than a mower.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Blower okay, vacuum sucks! Too long for a short person.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this product. It is just too unwieldy for an older woman who's 5 ft. tall. The tube is too long. In addition to that, you have to actually place the vacuum tube right on top of the debris to pick it up. It's hard to remove leaves from under a shrub, and it would not pick up elm seeds, which is why we bought it. Dust flew through the fabric of the bag and just covered us; breathing that junk is not good, but we had not anticipated the problem. The blower works fine, but that's only half of what the product is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: careful shopper

customer_reviews.title: Leaky bag connection
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Can't believe this is the same company that built my 27 year old lawn mower that still works fine. Packaged well. The plastic vacuum-bag connection leaked debrie on me right from the minute it was started. I had to wrap duct tape around the plastic connection to seal the dust from blowing out on me. The length of the tube was too long to use comfortably for a 5'9" man. I finally cut 4" on the suction end of the tube in order to operate it comfortably. I feel this is poorly designed and average quality.
customer_reviews.author: eileen hopster

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Really like this. Greater blower speed than my Husqvarna gas blower. I actually bought it for the vacuum capability -- didn't want to spend the $$ for a gas blower/vac. Was actually more than half the price of similarly-capable a gas blower/vac and more powerful. I'm only cleaning leaves and such close around the house, so don't mind the power cord requirement. It handles well and has a good capacity bag. I've used it a half-dozen times so far and it's worked to my satisfaction. Yeah, like one guy said it's a pain to haul around a long electric cord and have it fall out occasionally, but if you hold the cord it's not such a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: RanchMan

customer_reviews.title: Boy this thing blows...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to help manage our leaves that drop each year. It has a strong output and works well. We have a large yard and so we use a 100' 12 awg heavy duty cord, with tight fitting connection. This pulls 12 amps and a heavy gauge cord is required to prevent overheating. We haven't user the vacume feature, we just blow leaves with it... Overall, we like it and it works well for us...
customer_reviews.author: ChuckleHead

customer_reviews.title: Blower Vac
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this mulcher vac. Do not use it for blowing. The secret is in the speed adjustment. This allows debris removal from various kinds of crushed rock and rubber mulch. The bag and strap are a little different. The zipper at the bottom of the bag works well, load after load.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L

customer_reviews.title: Love the Power!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Toro electric blower. My first one lasted 14 years so, for me, buying this new one was a no-brainer. I really like the powerful blower and the way the speed control knob can adjust the power level in fine increments. It has adjustable nozzels too which is a very good feature. I haven't had the need to operate the vacuum/shredder feature yet but will use it this fall. I also really like the electric cord/plug locking feature that is welcomed design. For my needs--as a homeowner--I think this blower is every bit a high quality product and I can enthusiastically recommend this blower to other homeowners or businesses.
customer_reviews.author: JPTman

customer_reviews.title: Great leaf vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best if not the best yard tool I have purchased. I'm 76 and have purchase many home products. This is an unbelievable product for what it cost. I have a small yard, 60 x 120 ft. with several large trees. I also get lots of leaves from my neighbors. It is ideal for my situation. It has super suction for it's size. Easy to use and is well designed. I have had one problem. The safety switch failed and it could not be replaced. However, it has a two year guarantee and Toro replaced it with a new unit immediately at no charge to me.
customer_reviews.author: ChuckSue10

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect!
customer_reviews.text: The blower is very powerful yet easily handled with one hand. The vacuum function works well. The steel impeller makes quick work of twigs and small sticks. Using the catch bag you can quickly reduce what would be 2 or 3 bags of leaves down to half a bag. The bag does get heavy as it fills and once the strap is properly adjusted, can be handled pretty well. One of the best pieces of yard equipment in the shed.
customer_reviews.author: Hazeman

customer_reviews.title: It handles most everything really well.
customer_reviews.text: Love these Toros. Been through 3 over the last 8 years. It handles most everything really well. But, every once in awhile, a rock gets picked up and takes our a fin on the turbine. Would be nice it not pot metal. But compared to what is available, I will keep coming back to this brand. Very reliable, and each few years, their models are perfected a bit more. I will say, we have a ton of gumballs, from the tree, this eats em up fairly well, but that constant stress might be contributing to the stress break in a fin.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Spindler

customer_reviews.title: So powerful
customer_reviews.text: This powerful blower cuts my yard time more than half. It's a bit of a pain to switch over from blower to vacuum, but it does both so well that I'm OK with that. The instructions could be better on how to do the switch, but I figured it out. It came missing a piece and Amazon support got me the piece at no extra cost. I'm satisfied and almost love to get those leaves up and off the lawn and pavement. It really works well.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Sue

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this blower to replace the old one of the same model of which I had for some time. Old stopped working after many long hours of use over the years. I was impressed with the durability and strength of air that this product produces which makes clean up fast and easy. The amount of air power is always the concern with the cordless models, that is why I stayed with this corded blower.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge N.

customer_reviews.title: When the wind blows..grab your Toro!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, my neighbor has this huge tree in her yard, I on the other hand have no trees...so guess why I had to buy a leaf blower??? Yep you got it...her tree lets go of the leaves and I get to clean them up...because that's the way the wind blows!! But hey, my husband opened the box, set the Toro up...took it outside and had so much fun..the whole back yard is done, relatively fast too I may add. It has a beefy sound to it so I hope it lasts for a while (as that tree is here to stay!) Im really glad i bought this Toro, it does what it should and its a pretty red.
customer_reviews.author: GamingLadyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Shocked twice
customer_reviews.text: When we finally got this new item out of the box to use, my boyfriend was shocked not once, but TWICE! I asked him why he kept going after the first one..... I guess there is some kind of static build up when you use the vac in Phx. No mention of this anywhere in the literature.....you might get shocked if.... Wonderful. So if you can handle a few hundred volts ripping through your body, this is the blower for you! If not, keep looking and do not be enticed by the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sunni A

customer_reviews.title: Job perfection, Tops!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Toro Electric blower and vacuum machine for my son who has a large garden around the house with lots of "leavy" trees and I witnessed him using this equipment on several occasions. It does the job perfect! It has enormous power!But so is the NOISE that's enormous too! The first time he used it the neighbors were coming out to see where hell burst out! Watching my son doing this job in a very short time made the neighbors wanted to buy it too. Maybe the manufacturer can do some exploration work on the Tremendous Noise, they all agree! So Job plus Sound minus!
customer_reviews.author: Liesel

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful blower!
customer_reviews.text: I had just retired an older model Toro Ultra blower, so I had high expectations with this new blower. I suspect that this blower is more robust than my previous Toro and that's good. Kudos to whoever designed the power cord retention feature; it really works and that's not always the case. Best of all, though - this blower seems substantially more powerful than the previous model! I can really move the grass and leaves! I'm a very happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: C. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these blowers and they are great. Lots of power and adjustable so you can control what you blow off like leaves in a rock bed so the leaves go and the rock stay. Or you can turn it up and blow of just anything. The suction impeller works great for sucking up leaves too or other things. I used it to suck up saw dust and wood chips from the construction crews building my new house to keep the job site clean, worked great. Just make sure there are no nails in the wood chips, the aluminum impeller won't like that.
customer_reviews.author: deddy

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. It wouldn’t suck up dry leaves unless I had the suction tube pressed up and over the leaves. Very disappointed and can’t recommend. Maybe mine was faulty but it just did not work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch - Palm Springs, CA

customer_reviews.title: Lots of air
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to blow snow up here in Alaska Really wet snow not so good but I knew that. This morning 4 inches of new snow at 12 degrees more light and fluffy and this thing went to town. Blew off 5 vehicles and a swath of my driveway about 25 feet by 75 feet in less than 14 minutes. Nice. I researched a bunch and this blower had the highest rated air flow. You will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: WorkingDeuce

customer_reviews.title: Damaged box, damaged item?
customer_reviews.text: Arrived yesterday in a beat-up box. I was worried if I'd received a used item. After opening, it seemed new. It was easy to put together and worked as described. The vacuum function is just so so but blow function is good. I found one corner joint has one inch of discoloration, it could have been damaged from the shipping; however, the spot seemed getting bigger when I switched from vacuum to blow function. I'm worried if it is about to crack open if I assemble and disassemble it one more time, it is plastic after all. Because of this, I gave it three stars instead of four.
customer_reviews.author: AMZShopper

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, not as powerful as i had hoped
customer_reviews.text: Solid product, though the power isn't what I expected. Years ago I had a Toro blower that was significantly more powerful. It does its job, just not as well as I had hoped. Granted I have only used it to blow the driveway. When fall comes and I have to blow leaves I'll update. I will say that this is no where near as strong as my previous gas blower. So far I have not had any issues with the switch that others have complained about.
customer_reviews.author: F. Lang

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable power
customer_reviews.text: I love the adjustable knob to control the power of the blower. This is the main reason I purchased this one. Works great when your in a tight space and need more control of where the debris is being blown. Then you have full power in more open areas like sidewalks. Haven’t use the vacuum part and bag and doubt I ever will but it does come with that option.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond W. Boehringer

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum power is sweet!
customer_reviews.text: This unit was purchased mainly for the vacuum feature. It has better power than the Black & Decker model we bought. We previously returned it to get this one. The suction allows the easy pick up of leaves and debris into the bag. The ONLY thing about this is that the bag is white, and so, using this item, it gets dirty easily, but hey, it's a bag to suck up dirt and leaves so what is to be expected? Anyway, it is not cordless, you need to plug this in, but you don't have to worry about batteries dying out in the middle of use. Overall, this is a really good unit. Easy to carry and maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: TRFBTop Contributor: Drums

customer_reviews.title: So much easier to clean out shrubbery and bushes!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough about this blower vac! It picks up leaves in my yard and makes it so easy to get them out of shrubbery, etc. The leaves get mulched down to small pieces, and I am surprised to see how much ground I cover before I need to empty the bag. Well made and very efficient. Have not used the blower, as I have a separate, cheap blower to use. But for leaf pickup and mulching, this item is perfect. Adjustable for the strength of suction but I've been safe from taking up pea gravel.
customer_reviews.author: Greyhound Lady

customer_reviews.title: Overheating
customer_reviews.text: We had a toro leaf blower for 6 years and it gave out last month. I ordered this one and it’s going back. On the highest setting, it barely blew anything off our deck, and it got really hot, like the motor was giving out.
customer_reviews.author: Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: It actually works!
customer_reviews.text: Rain is in tonight's forecast and I had two large drain grates already covered in wet leaves. In 30 minutes I had vacuumed 4 bags (fully packed) of wet and finely (is that a word?) chipped leaves and twigs. I was hesitant to buy this vacuum as I had never owned one that actually worked as advertised. I have no idea how the blower works since I only purchased this for the vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: William Foley

customer_reviews.title: Great for mulching
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that this vacuums up the leafs and mulches them. A little trick I learned is to leave the bag's zipper cracked just a bit too allow air to escape while vacuuming and keep your bag from ballooning. I find it really easy to empty the mulch bag into a contractor bag for disposal. It can be a bit unwieldy since it is electric and you need to be attached to an extension cord, but at the price that's a minor draw back.
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: Simple and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I used my new Toro Ultra (51619) blower/vacuum/mulcher yesterday for the first time. It was very easy to assemble and easy to use. I found that it was more powerful than I needed when blowing pin oak leaves. I switched to the vacuum/mulching operation and it easily sucked up leaves and acorns. I tried to avoid the acorns and just vacuum leaves, but some acorns did get sucked up. They went through the impeller easily and without damaging anything. I checked the impeller several times during the cleanup to make sure it was not being damaged. I think I am going to love using this blower/vacuum/mulcher.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: A very powerful machine
customer_reviews.text: I am a Toro fan for the last 25 years and this blower is a winner. It is a little heavier than my old blower, but then it is twice as powerful. A superior feature is that the extension cord to the blower now plugs into a mini heavy duty extension on the blower itself and my old blower had the plug prongs on the body of the blower and they eventually broke off.
customer_reviews.author: Trooper

customer_reviews.title: Works great but is on the heavy side
customer_reviews.text: This blower/vac works great in vac mode It is has a variable rheostat, which allows you slow the vac down to prevent sucking up rocks (in my case). Just tried the blower, which I don't need. It did however have lots of power. The only downfall of this unit is it is rather heavy. I used mine for over 1 hour and was getting tired of holding it. Otherwise for the money it is a good value and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: very powerful blower and mulcher
customer_reviews.text: we have had this product for several months now and wanted to wait to give a detailed review after use. The item is a very powerful unit. even going into corners with alot of leaves you can easily move them out of corners and put into big piles. The mulcher is fantastic but the bag gets far too heavy for my son and I to carry as we have arthritis and collagen disease. over all its a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: A lot of power, great deal
customer_reviews.text: I havent had mine long so I will update later. I havent used it as a vacuum yet but I can review on the blower...it is awesome! It's got alot of power, blows the leaves like you wouldn't believe. It's pretty light. I'm not very big (130 lbs, 5'3" ) and I think it easy to handle. The kids use it also. I'm so glad I went for the electric, the gas ones are heavy and too expensive, plus I'd rather just plug in and go.
customer_reviews.author: Karrie M

customer_reviews.title: This a great blower its got tons of power as long as ...
customer_reviews.text: This a great blower its got tons of power as long as you use the proper power cord it calls for 12v. I tryed it with a 10v cord after I used it with a 12v and instantly felt the power drop. The vacuum system work well( not great with wet leafs)as long as you only have leafs it won't handle pine cones well which you shouldn't try to shred anyway. I cleared my wet drive way in no time with this compared to my old battry ryubi blower. I'm really happy with this blower and if you can deal with the power cord you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: R. R. Lopezlazo

customer_reviews.title: Very Powerful Electric Blower/Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we've owned. We had the first one nearly 10 years when it conked out. When I bought the first one, I never thought it would be so powerful and also lightweight and easy to use. Highly recommend this handy tool. It gets the job done in no time. The leaf vacuum works well too, just not on wet leaves or grass.
customer_reviews.author: Diane MC

customer_reviews.title: small jobs only.
customer_reviews.text: this corded blower has a little less than half of the power/productivity as a good gas unit. far more convenient for blowing off driveways though due to the simple nature of it. 4 stars instead of 5 because it's not 240v. with 240volts, these things could keep up with the competition. the industry'd better switch over to 240v, dammit. Similar situation for the battery powered blowers, but at least electric codes give the corded blower companies a valid excuse to produce an inferior electric product, unlike cordless battery backpack units. there really isn't any excuse to keep electric blowers from kicking the competition's asz.
customer_reviews.author: pen name with pen

customer_reviews.title: One quibble, otherwise I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I like this with one little quibble. It is hard to get the attachments off to change between blower and vacuum. I have to use tools to pry the vacuum attachment off, partly because the clip is stiff and partly because the cord comes out right where I would want to put my hand to manipulate the clip. The bag comes off easily, and I like this bag design better than the old one I had, which had a velcro wrap-around to attach it. The power is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: LaWeezel

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 uses.
customer_reviews.text: The blower and vacuum worked great..... for two times. The 3rd time using it, it just shut off. At first, I thought the cord fell out or maybe even tripped the outlet. However, I’m guessing the motor blew or something else happens as it won’t even turn on after that. I am trying to contact customer service so we will see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Ensmann

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Love it, love it, love it. I am 68 years old and have lumbar stenosis and lumbar radiculopathy. Both conditions cause great pain when I do too much work that involves bending and twisting. The Toro Blower/Vac is great, light enough for me to carry around, and does a super job with the variable blower and vacuum speed adjustment. I can blow or vacuum at a high speed (which sends everything in its way flying), or vacuum at a lower speed over small pebbles and mulch and the vacuum picks up only the top layer of fallen leaves. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Maddux

customer_reviews.title: Save time and money by vacuuming up all the leaves.
customer_reviews.text: Don't spend hours raking leaves, just hook up the vacuum, power up and suck up all them leaves. Use as garden filler or compost or 1/10th the size for the yard debris can. Saves money.
customer_reviews.author: Paul L.

customer_reviews.title: Great vac/ blower combo
customer_reviews.text: Great vac/blower combo. This is the second one I have purchased and only because I broke the first one being dumb. I have put this vac to the test and it will suck up small rock, sticks and large leaves no problem. It has a metal impeller that is as tough as nails! Love using it in the fall for leaf pickup as it mulches the leaves so you can stuff even more in a bag or can for disposal.
customer_reviews.author: Tom T

customer_reviews.title: Nice electric leaf blower
customer_reviews.text: My husband had me order this a few weeks ago and has used it numerous times since. He likes the way it operates, its size, weight, etc. We have numerous outdoor plug-ins and heavy duty, contractor grade extension cords, so an electric leaf blower works fine for us, and is much lighter than the gas ones. Toro makes good products.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Zachariasen

customer_reviews.title: This was perfect for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Went back and forth with battery or gas and didn’t want to deal with a carburetor rebuild in three years and didn’t want to pay the hefty price for the battery alternative that didn’t give up on power. This is perfect and the price point is way below what you get from a power or performance aspect. Get a couple of 50 ft extension cords and close the deal.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Bitgood

customer_reviews.title: The Super outperforms the ULTRA when it comes to leaf extraction
customer_reviews.text: It seems that the metal impeller on the ULTRA reduces engine performance over nylon impeller on the Super model blower. I have a super and I just purchased the ULTRA within one hour of use burned out and it did not handle leaf extraction and composting as well as the super model. Amazon is replacing the ULTRA with a new unit. So I'll let you know how this one works out. The super model is still running strong.
customer_reviews.author: Rock Barras

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job Well
customer_reviews.text: The device readily converts from the leaf blower to the vacuum. The blower speed is adjustable from low to high and all speeds in between. The vacuum does a nice job of mulching leaves. The vacuum bag is not the most comfortable to wear over one's shoulder as it fills up but it does have a large capacity to hold mulched leaves. The two pieces that make up the vacuum do not fit together nor come apart easily. The soft plastic requires some maneuvering (pushing and/or tugging). After an hour or so of vacuuming, you start to feel the weight of the motor. Overall, pleased with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: BronxNative

customer_reviews.title: Aluminum impeller thin and fragile / Heavy blower
customer_reviews.text: When I read, "metal impeller" I was thrilled to get it even though it said that it was heavy. Very disappointed when I used it to vacuum maybe 900 square foot lawn with mostly hard sandy soil, and I inspected the impeller only to find that in that short time of use, the impeller was already worn! I hope to find replacement impellers at a goof price! I'll need to have a few spares! I tried, so far not luck on even finding one!!!! And this thing is just so heavy, you better be in good shape to use it!
customer_reviews.author: Claude M.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and flexible but less maneuverable if you're under 5 7
customer_reviews.text: It's powerful and useful, I very much like the flexibility but the strap on the bag and the cone on the vacuum are too long for my height. I'm 5 foot 7 which I didn't think was short until I used this. The bag strap doesn't cold any weight from the unit whatsoever and slips off so I have to go crossbody with it even when it's on its shortest length. The cone on the vacuum is angled perfectly to create the best suction and vacuum but I'm too short to hold it straight down unless I lift the unit up. It makes it tiring to use.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona.

customer_reviews.title: Efficient vac but clumsy to use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased blower/vac for vacuum feature. Does a good job. Easy to use but the bag strap, as others have pointed out, is awkward. Easy to adjust but difficult to get right adjustment so strap does not fall off your shoulder. Not a big deal but annoying. I'm tall. I would think a shorter person might find bag and strap challenging. But I'm happy with overall functionality.
customer_reviews.author: LJR's View

customer_reviews.title: Bulky and slow
customer_reviews.text: As far as a blower it is great for the money. As a vacuum it is bulky and clumsy, does not particularly like any leaves that are wet and sucks at a slow rate. Also, if leaves are wet, not sure how to clean the suction (metal blade) area, not sure if water is ok or will void warranty. Also not sure how to clean bag, no instructions. Bag gets dirty but will not separate from plastic pieces. Overall, for the 2-digit price, it will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Davis

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Does its job perfectly .... loads of blowing power and like having the variable speed control. The only knock on this machine could be the weight ... certainly not the lightest leaf blower available. Overall very happy with this product ... have never used the vacuum feature and can’t comment on its ability to work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: TMM

customer_reviews.title: It produces great thrust for an electric blower
customer_reviews.text: It produces great thrust for an electric blower. Everything else goes downhill from there. This is an old design, I had this exact blower years ago, it was the base model but everything was exactly the same. The plastic used on the shell is extremely hard and brittle. Now on to the accessories... Everything is separate and it has to be stored separately, very space consuming. It blows hard, beyond that it leaves a lot to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R Perry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product !!
customer_reviews.text: Very good value ... Works very well to push air and vacuum air. The add-ons [vacuum bag; tube adjustments work well] The variable speeds are an excellent help to adjust power based on where it is being used. Then only slight criticism is the vacuum bag doesn't hold small dirt well ... it tend to push through the bag material -- One reason is the strength of the motor and speed adjustment ... its difficult to hold when pulling air that hard. I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Arama

customer_reviews.title: This works Great!
customer_reviews.text: It took me a few minutes to connect everything, but I did not read the directions! I love the variable speed for the motor and the extra nozzles diffidently increase the power. It will clean out the crevices. I used it last weekend to clear the driveway off from the dusting of snow. Worked like a champ and shortened the time I was outside. The leaf attachment reduced my bags from 12 down to 3 and a half mulched. Absolutely a great product!
customer_reviews.author: DenAlex89

customer_reviews.title: Quality machine
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the noise of the gas powered so I went with this one. Excellent blowing power, pick up seems to be decent, it did clog with some wet leaves which is to be expected. Curious to see how it blows all my leaves into piles this fall. I think it will fair well, I use it blow all the grass off my sidewalks after mowing and it handles it quite easily.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: No more pulling the crank on a gas engine that didn't want to start
customer_reviews.text: I've been happy with the wind speed/power that puts out, and the fact that I don't have to struggle to start a gas engine anymore. I think this product was less than I would have paid to get my gas engine repaired. It'll take a little getting used to having a power cord again. That said, this product has a good mechanism for looping the cord around and locking in place. Very lightweight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is like any tool you have for your yard but it does both vacuuming and blowing very good. I have read other reviews about the vacuum bag i have found that when you empty the be sure you get it completely empty so that will keep dirt particles from jamming the zipper so you don't end up damaging the zipper .
customer_reviews.author: Owen Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Same High Quality & up-to-date improvements
customer_reviews.text: I've owned Toro Blower/Vac(s) as far back as I can remember, and they have always been Total Quality. Unfortunately, my older unit (with a plastic impeller), suffered broken spokes due to some nasty item I sucked up at my daughters. This new unit (with a metal impeller) works much better, and I no longer need to worry about those hidden items breaking points off the impeller. I feel this unit is of the same High Quality, and even More useful with an up-to-date impeller that won't easily break.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B.

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful blower and vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Due to my arthritis, it’s hard for me to change out the attachments from blower to sucker. I liked it so much, that I bought two, one that I strictly uses a blower and the other I strictly use as a sucker. I use it to blow powdery snow off my driveway in the winter, and to go and suck up the leaves the rest of the year.
customer_reviews.author: Suzie

customer_reviews.title: Toro 51619 vs SunJoe SBJ605E : winner = Toro
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased the Sun Joe model, then decided to buy this model from Toro, to see which one I like best. The pictures include a summary comparison sheet depicting my experience with the two. They are very similar blowers in terms of paid price, warranty and the quality of materials. I found Toro to be more powerful as a blower, more efficient (lower consumption) and with a lower noise level. Sun Joe may have better models as well, however between these two, I liked better the Toro blower. Besides speed, the volume (cfm) is quite important Sharing this in case other shoppers have the same dilemma.
customer_reviews.author: DeFo

customer_reviews.title: Vacuums but not mulching
customer_reviews.text: Pretty bummed.... i got good results at first when i tried it on a couple piles of leaves that had been stuck in a corner of a fence from last fall.... everything was mulched into nice small pieces so i kept it. That was a month ago. Now that my oak trees are starting to drop their leaves i thought i would give it another go. The suction was great and the bag seemed to fill up fast but to my dismay the leaves were mostly whole... i bought it for the mulching capabilities so now kind of bummed and it's past the return window... Hoping Toro can help .. we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Richeetee

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, nothing great.
customer_reviews.text: It is heavy. Suction tube is too big around to get inside bushes where leaves and blossoms fall. Doesn't carry well over the shoulder while using.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Aldridge

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine - Does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is designed to do. My only difficulty is the bag. It is a little cumbersome. Probably because I haven't used it much. Still trying to figure out the best way to carry it. My lawn mower works just as well and ended up using it instead. I am sure there are times where this will work better than my lawn mower.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Langford

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: Works well to clean up leaves, helicopters and other loose debris( not small twigs). Is clumsy to use, as the bag fills it becomes imbalanced. Shreds the debris well before filling bag. I did not use it as a blower. Overall I like it, it does the job but the design makes using it cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Jagshere

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: If you're on the fence about this item, please don't hesitate for a moment! It works exactly as described. I use it for leaf blowing & collecting & vacuuming. I was pleasantly surprised by the power & function for such a reasonable price. It's well made, very easy to assemble & convert from blower to vac. This item truly exceeded my expectations & I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Apple

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Just received the product. Used it to clear behind a hedge line with the blower then vacuumed up the debris. So much easier than raking. The power dial works well to prevent blowing all the mulch off the beds. Even set at low you do have to be careful or you will mulch your lawn. Reduced what would have been many barrels of debris to one barrel. The leaves are from a Hong Kong Orchid. Very large and tough. No problem.
customer_reviews.author: Elect. Eng.

product_meta.title: Toro 51619 Ultra Electric Blower Vac, 250 mph, Red
product_meta.description: Toro is the no. 1 rated Brand. The ultra electric blower vac delivers all the power & versatility you need to tackle yd clean-up chores. It offers a rugged metal impeller & variable speed air Control. Its blower inserts for multiple applications allow you to tackle any space. The powerful, up to 260-mph, air stream clears debris, sticks & large, heavy leaves. It converts quickly to an aggressive vacuum without any tools & reduces 88% of mulched debris to less than 1/2". New Bottom-zip vacuum bag's zipper strategically placed for durability & ease of use. Smaller debris means more fit into the bag. This product is covered by a two-year full. You can't buy a more powerful electric blower/vac than a Toro.
feature_bullets: New larger metal impeller drives power and improved mulching
Vacuum tube, bottom-zip bag, power insert, concentrator nozzle and cord storage hook included; Extension cord not included
Variable speed control for better control in both blower and vac mode
Top rated air horse power degree degree for comparison purposes only; Performance claims based on controlled laboratory testing
Blower is corded. 350 CFM blow mode and 410 CFM Vac mode

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,465 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
